articles.author: Dumebi Okolo
articles.description:
SDN is especially useful for large or legacy companies that have the bulk of their IT infrastructure hardware-based.
I haven't been on Dev Community for so lomg, I came bcak to 100+ notifications. üòÖ I missed y'all too! 
As someone who is going deeper and deeper into networking, and plans to work remotely, figuring out SDN and how it can benefit organizations--even legacy ones--is a big win for me. 
software-defined networking (SDN) ‚Äî an architecture that abstracts the ‚Äúcontrol‚Äù of the network from the physical hardware and moves it into software, giving IT teams the flexibility, speed, and insight today‚Äôs digital initiatives demand. (techtarget.com)

Is SDN?


Simply speaking, SDN separates the control plane (the brains) from the data plane (the muscle). A centralized SDN controller progr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Software-Defined Networking (SDN): What It Is ‚Äî and Why Your Company Needs It

articles.author: Bap
articles.description:
What Happened: GitHub‚Äôs Cloud-Based Agent Drafts PRs Autonomously


GitHub announced a major new capability for Copilot:

GitHub has unveiled a significant upgrade to Copilot during Microsoft Build 2025: a cloud-based coding agent capable of drafting and iterating on pull requests directly within GitHub. While previous Copilot experiences focused on in-editor assistance via VSCode, this new agent runs asynchronously in the cloud, leveraging an infrastructure similar to GitHub Actions.
Developers can now assign tasks directly via GitHub or VSCode:
@github Open a pull request to refactor this query generator into its own class
With the addition of MCP, developers can even grant the agent access to external tools and data by configuring servers directly in the repository settings. This abstra‚Ä¶
articles.title: GitHub Unveils Copilot Coding Agent at Build 2025

articles.author: Gaming News
articles.description:
MindsEye developer Build a Rocket Boy just lost two of its bigwigs a week before the game‚Äôs June 10 launch: Chief Legal Officer Riley Graebner and CFO Paul Bland. Graebner‚Äôs LinkedIn sign-off praised the studio‚Äôs growth to over 450 staff but didn‚Äôt spill on why he bowed out, while Bland quietly moved on after two years in the finance chair.
Fans on the official Discord are buzzing with ‚Äúsus‚Äù theories‚Äîeverything from internal drama to legal red flags if MindsEye hits launch day buggy. Studio co-CEO Mark Gerhard has already blamed a ‚Äúconcerted effort‚Äù for the pre-release negativity, and Eurogamer has reached out to Build a Rocket Boy for comment.
articles.title: MindsEye studio execs depart Build a Rocket Boy, one week before game's debut

articles.author: Rachel-Lee Nabors
articles.description:
Chrome is the next IE6.
The signs are there. A few years back, Google cut funding to longstanding community contractors working on standards with the W3C. Community members I spoke with at CSS Day 2023 in Amsterdam found the move confusing, given that Google had supported this vital work for so many years. And maybe it was important‚Äîto the Web. But what Google was saying with its actions was, ‚ÄúThis work is not important for Google right now.‚Äù
And with good reason. For the first time ever, Google searches are dropping. And despite rhetoric that ‚Äúusers won‚Äôt pay to use the Web‚Äù they are paying to use AI services competing with the Web like Perplexity. This happened once before when mobile apps hit the scene, and Google rose to defend the Web (and its advertising income) by launching Chrome, ‚Ä¶
articles.title: IE6, AI, and the future of browsing the Web
